question: Are you (tú) buying it for me?
Is she buying it for Miguel?
We are not buying it because it’s too expensive.
answer: No lo compramos porque es demasiado caro.

question: They are buying a new car on Saturday.
answer: Compran un coche nuevo el sábado.

question: You (formal, plural) need a big car.
You (formal, singular) need to do it like that.
You don’t need to do it three times.
He is waiting for the bus.
She doesn’t want to wait for you.
You (infornal) are going to need him.
You (informal, plural) need her because it’s too difficult.
answer: La necesitáis porque es demasiado difícil.

question: I'm going to lift you up. (informal, singular)
I'm going to leave it in the house.
answer: Voy a dejarlo en la casa.

question: Don't leave it on the table. (informal, singular)
answer: No lo dejes en la mesa.

question: Leave me next to the hotel. (informal, singular)
Wait for us behind the supermarket.
Don't wait for us if you want to leave soon.
answer: No nos esperes si quieres irte/salir pronto.

question: I don’t want to leave you here.
Do you need them (men and women) tonight?
No, I need them next week.
answer: No, los necesito la semana que viene.

question: We are selling it next week.
answer: Lo vendemos la semana que viene.

question: Are you selling them next year?
They don’t sell telephones in the market.
answer: No venden teléfonos en el mercado.

question: Are you selling the white one or the blue one?
Can I see the house that you are selling (formal,singular)?
I want to buy the car that you (formal, plural) are selling.
answer: Quiero comprar el coche que (ustedes) venden.

question: If you leave it on the table, she is going to drink it.
answer: Si lo dejas en la mesa, (ella) va a beberlo.

question: The woman drinks less than the man.
answer: La mujer bebe menos que el hombre.

question: Don't drink it if you don’t like it.
answer: No lo bebas, si no te gusta.

question: I only eat what he leaves on the table.
answer: Solo como lo que deja en la mesa.

question: You (plural, formal) only eat in the restaurant
You understand that I have to leave.
We live near the big supermarket.
They don't live in Palma. They live in Barcelona
answer: No viven en Palma. Viven en Barcelona.

question: They write it too small for me.
answer: Lo escriben demasiado pequeño para mí.

question: Write your name here, please.
answer: Escribe su nombre aquí, por favor.

question: I think that there are a few things in the car.
answer: Pienso que hay unas cosas en el coche.

question: At what time do we start?
We’re closing the hotel next year.
answer: Cerramos el hotel el año que viene.

question: I don't understand why you are buying it.
answer: No entiendo por qué lo compras.

question: If you don’t understand me it’s not my problem.
answer: Si no me entendéis, no es mi problema.

question: I want to play with her, but she doesn’t want to play with me.
answer: Quiero jugar con ella, pero (ella) no quiere jugar conmigo.

question: We don't want to eat in that restaurant.
answer: No queremos comer en ese restaurante.

question: I don't have a problem with her.
answer: No tengo un problema con ella.

question: She has a lot of problems.
We have it today because they have it tomorrow.
answer: Lo tenemos hoy porque (ellos) lo tienen mañana.

question: You can learn Spanish very quickly.
answer: (vosotros) Podéis aprender el español muy rápido.

question: I'm coming back in a few minutes.
I don't understand why you aren’t coming back today.
answer: (vosotros) No entiendo por qué no volvéis hoy.

question: I don’t know if he remembers my name.
answer: No sé si recuerda mi nombre.

question: I only see what I want to see.
answer: Solo veo lo que quiero ver.

question: Why don’t you come with them?
If he doesn’t come today, we can’t do it.
answer: Si no viene hoy, no podemos hacerlo.

question: I don't understand why you are hot, but I’m cold.
answer: No entiendo por qué tu tienes calor, pero (yo) tengo frío.

question: It's cold in London, but it’s hot in Madrid.
answer: Hace frío en Londres, pero hace calor en Madrid.

question: I have to eat something because I’m hungry.
answer: Tengo que comer algo porque tengo hambre.

question: I have to drink something because I’m thirsty.
answer: Tengo que beber algo porque tengo sed.

question: I have a lot of money in the bank.
answer: Tengo mucho dinero en el banco.

question: It's very late, I’m very tired and I’m very hungry.
answer: Es muy tarde, estoy muy cansado/a, y tengo mucha hambre.

question: The dog wants water because it’s thirsty.
answer: El perro quiere agua porque tiene sed.

question: The cat doesn’t want to eat because it’s not hungry.
answer: El gato no quiere comer porque no tiene hambre.

question: to take, grab, pick up, get
Don't take it because it’s very hot!
answer: ¡No lo cojas porque está muy caliente!

question: Don't go out because it’s very cold.
answer: No salgas porque hace mucho frío.

question: Take the dog and put him in the car.
answer: Coge el perro y ponlo en el coche.

question: Don't do it today if it’s too hot.
answer: No lo hagas hoy si hace demasiado calor.

question: The red one’s hot but the blue one’s cold.
answer: El rojo está caliente pero el azul está frío.

question: There are a lot of people here.
There are a lot of people on the bus.
answer: Hay mucha gente en el bus.

question: There aren’t a lot of people on the train.
answer: No hay mucha gente en el tren.

question: There are a lot of good people in Spain.
answer: Hay mucha gente buena en España.

question: She's not here because she’s just left.
answer: No está aquí porque acaba de irse.

question: I’ve just left it on the table.
answer: Acabo de dejarlo en la mesa.

question: I've just learnt a new word.
answer: Acabo de aprender una palabra nueva.

question: We’ve just bought a new house in Mallorca.
answer: Acabamos de comprar una casa nueva en Mallorca.

question: Have you just taken Maria’s phone?
answer: ¿Acabas de coger el teléfono de María?

question: Stop calling me Pete. My name’s Peter.
answer: Deja de llamarme Pete. Me llamo Peter.

question: Stop playing with that cat.
answer: Deja de jugar con ese gato.

question: We are staying for two weeks.
I'm not staying in Barcelona. I’m leaving tomorrow.
answer: No me quedo en Barcelona. Me voy mañana.

question: How long are you going to stay?
How long are you going to stay?
I don't know how long we’re going to stay.
answer: No sé cuánto tiempo vamos a quedarnos.

question: I don't know yet how long I’m going to stay.
answer: No sé todavía cuánto tiempo voy a quedarme.

question: Can you tell me why they don’t have it yet.
answer: ¿Puedes decirme por qué no lo tienen todavía?

question: Do you want to have a beer?
We can have a coffee if you want.
answer: Podemos tomar un café si quieres.

question: We will have a water if we are thirsty.
answer: Tomaremos un agua si tenemos sed.

question: Do you want to have a sandwich here?
I’ll have a sandwich and a beer, please.
answer: Tomaré un bocadillo y una cerveza, por favor.

question: I’m not hungry because I’ve just eaten a sandwich.
answer: No tengo hambre porque acabo de comer/tomar un bocadillo.

question: I will speak to you tomorrow.
I will stay here this evening.
They will buy it if they have the money.
answer: Lo comprarán se tienen el dinero.

question: They won’t buy it because it’s too expenseive
answer: No lo comprarán porque es demasiado caro.

question: I will be here at one o’clock.
He will be here at eight o’clock.
It will be ready for you tomorrow.
They are going to be here soon.
I’m sorry but I’m not Carlos.
answer: Lo siento pero no soy Carlos.

question: We are Spanish but you are British.
They are good, but you are bad.
You are teachers (ustedes), but you are a student.
It won’t be possible for her today.
answer: No será posible para ella hoy.

question: A beer for me and a sandwich for you.
answer: Una cerveza para mí, y un bocadillo para ti.

question: It won’t be easy for us.
It will be too difficult for them.
It’s too fast for you. (plural, formal)
It won’t be easy for you to stop drinking.
answer: No será fácil para usted dejar de beber.

question: I will go and see it with her.
When will you go and do it?
We will go and have a beer with them.
answer: Iremos a tomar una cerveza con ellos/as.

question: he, she will have/you (usted) will have
We will leave with her if she is ready.
answer: Saldremos con ella si está lista.

question: I will put it behind the table.
answer: Lo pondré detrás de la mesa.

question: I will put it behind you.
They will put it here for us.
in the morning, in the afternoon, during/at night
answer: por la mañana, por la tarde, por la noche

question: We will do it in the morning.
She’ll do it with me in the afternoon
answer: Lo hará conmigo por la tarde.

question: They’ll do it during the night.
We will tell you in the morning.
When will you tell me, sir?
I want a bottle of wine and a glass of water.
answer: Quiero una botella de vino y un vaso de agua.

question: I’ve just had three glasses of wine.
answer: Acabo de tomar tres copas de vino.

question: A bottle of wine for us and a bottle of water for them,please
answer: Una botella de vino para nosotros y una botella de agua para ellos por favor.

question: Take (grab) two bottles of red wine and I’ll get a bottle of white.
answer: Coge dos botellas de vino tinto, y yo cogeré una botella de blanco.

question: I don’t know yet if they want red wine or white wine.
answer: No sé todavía si quieren vino tinto o vino blanco.

question: Have a sandwich if you are hungry.
answer: Toma un bocadillo si tienes hambre.

question: Have a glass of water if you’re thirsty.
answer: Toma un vaso de agua si tienes sed.

question: I’m going to order (to ask for) a glass of wine.
answer: Voy a pedir una copa de vino.

question: If you drink more wine, you’ll have a problem in the morning.
answer: Si bebes más vino, tendrás un problema por la mañana.

question: I want to do it again.
I want to do it again but this time with you.
answer: Quiero volver a hacerlo pero esta vez contigo.

question: I want to do it again but this time without you.
answer: Quiero volver a hacerlo pero esta vez sin ti.

question: I’m going to read the book again.
answer: Voy a volver a leer el libro.

question: You will be hungry again later.
answer: Volverás a tener hambree más tarde.

question: This is my father and this is my mother.
answer: Este es mi padre y esta es mi madre.

question: This is my daughter and this is my sister.
answer: Esta es mi hija y esta es mi hermana.

question: This is my brother and this is my hubsand.
answer: Este es mi hermano y este es mi marido/esposo.

question: Where are Miguel’s parents today?
answer: ¿Dónde están los padres de Miguel hoy?

question: This isn’t my wife. It’s my daughter.
answer: Esta no es mi esposa. Es mi hija.

question: I will see your brother today.
I won’t see your father today.
answer: No veré a tu padre hoy.

question: I’ll call your wife in the morning.
answer: Llamaré a tu esposa por la mañana.

question: I’m going to need your brother tomorrow.
answer: Voy a necesitar a tu hermano mañana.

question: I’m going to have a beer with your sister.
answer: Voy a tomar una cerveza con tu hermana.

question: Your wife ought to/must stop drinking.
answer: Tu mujer debe dejar de beber.

question: My sister’s will be rich if she can sell the house.
answer: Mi hermana sera rica si puede vender la casa.

question: My brothers are coming in the morning.
answer: Mis hermanos vienen por la mañana.

question: My children don’t learn very quickly.
answer: Mis hijos no aprenden muy rápido.

question: I’ve just spoken to my children.
answer: Acabo de hablar con mis hijos.

question: I will call my sisters in the the morning.
answer: Llamaré a mis hermanas por la mañana.

question: Your parents are coming without the car.
answer: Tus padres vienen sin el coche.

question: Your sisters want to do it again.
answer: Tus hermanas quieren volver a hacerlo.

question: I will speak to your children this afternoon.
answer: Hablaré con tus hijos esta tarde.

question: I can bring your sister if you want.
answer: Puedo traer a tu hermana si quieres.

question: Don’t lift you brother up like that.
answer: No levantes a tu hermano así.

question: I’m not her husband. I’m her brother.
answer: No soy su marido. Soy su hermano.

question: She’s not his sister. She’s his wife
answer: No es su hermana, es su esposa.

question: I want to speak to your sister. (formal)
I would like to speak to your father. (formal)
answer: Me gustaría hablar con su padre.

question: You have to find your things. (formal)
Your things won’t be here next year. (formal)
answer: Sus cosas no estarán aquí el año que viene.

question: Their parents are having a beer.
answer: Sus padres están tomando una cerveza.

question: Our mother eats less than our father.
answer: Nuestra madre come menos que nuestro padre.

question: Our daughter has just called our son.
answer: Nuestra hija acaba de llamar a nuestro hijo.

question: Our children aren’t very young.
answer: Nuestros hijos no son muy jóvenes.

question: I will do it for your brother.
We’ll do it without your sisters.
I like to learn new things.
We don’t want old things in our house.
answer: No queremos cosas viejas en nuestra casa.

question: We’ll do it in a moment.
Our parents are coming in a moment.
answer: Nuestros padres vienen en un momento.

question: I’ll be there in a moment.
You’ll need it in a moment.
I’m going to have a glass of wine in a moment.
answer: Voy a tomar una copa de vino en un momento.

question: I’m going to have another glass of wine.
answer: Voy a tomar otra copa de vino.

question: They want to stay here another day.
Can you get another bottle of water?
Why do you want to learn another language?
How many languages do you speak?
How many rooms are there in the hotel?
I’m sorry but we don’t understand your language.
answer: (usted) Lo siento pero no entendemos su idioma.

question: Can you speak another language, please?
You have to do it the same day.
answer: Tienes que hacerlo el mismo día.

question: If you work a lot you can do it all the same day.
answer: Si trabajas mucho puedes hacerlo todo el mismos día.

question: It’s too big (for) to bring it all the same day
answer: Es demasiado grande para traerlo todo el mismo día.

question: I’ve just seen the same woman
answer: Acabo de ver a la misma mujer.

question: They are students but she’s a teacher.
answer: Son estudiantes pero ella es profesora.

question: The swimming pool isn’t very big.
answer: La piscina no es muy grande.

question: I’m sorry but that woman is not very nice.
answer: Lo siento pero esa mujer no es muy simpática.

question: These cars are older than those cars.
answer: Estos carros son más viejos que esos coches.

question: Our daughter learns faster than our son.
answer: Nuestra hija aprende más rápido que nuestro hijo.

question: My husband is nicer than your husband.
answer: Mi marido es mas simpático que tu marido.

question: My son speaks less Spanish than my daughter
answer: Mi hijo habla menos español que mi hija.

question: Will you do it for her?
We have lunch in the same restaurant every day.
answer: Comemos en el mismo restaurante cada día.

question: They’re not going to arrive at the same time.
answer: No van a llegar a la misma hora.

question: I want the same as you.
Why do you want the same as me?
answer: ¿Por qué quieres lo mismo que yo?

question: I speak the same language as you.
answer: Hablo el mismo idioma que tú.

question: We don’t speak the same language as them.
answer: No hablamos el mismo idioma que ellos.

question: They’re coming at the same time as us.
answer: Vienen a la misma hora que nosotros.

question: I don’t want the same things as you.
answer: No quiero las mismas cosas que tú.

question: We don’t start at the same time as them.
answer: No empezamos a la misma hora que ellos/as.

question: You don’t drink the same beer as her.
answer: (usted) (Usted) no bebe la misma cerveza que ella.

question: They don’t know the same things as you.
answer: (ustedes) Ellos no saben las mismas cosas que ustedes.

question: We don’t work the same days as his parents.
answer: No trabajamos los mismos días que sus padres.

question: I don’t read the same books as your teacher.
answer: No leo los mismos libros que tu profesor.

question: You’re not going to buy the same car as me.
answer: No vas a comprar el mismo coche que yo.

question: My parents are Spanish but I’m American.
answer: Mis padres son españoles pero (yo) soy americano.

question: I’m old but you are young.
answer: (vosotros/as) Soy viejo/a pero vosotros/as sois jóvenes.
